revised_title: The Impact of Flow Unsteadiness on Droplet Nucleation in Steam Turbines
tldr: The authors present a new theory explaining the formation and growth of water droplets in steam turbines, focusing on the influence of large-scale static temperature fluctuations caused by blade wake interactions. This theory predicts broad droplet size distributions, which are in better agreement with experimental measurements in real turbines compared to conventional steady-flow calculations.
scientific_discipline: Engineering and Technology > Steam Turbine Engineering
